pageTitle: Stringforum.net: Reviews of the Signum Pro Poly Plasma 1.18
textBeforeTable: Comments: comfortable, explosive, precise StringAdjectives n/a Similar string(s): I compared it to my previous string on the Wilson nSix-One 95 18x20, a Tecnifibre NGR2 16 gauge. The Poly Plasma just lacks in the spin department (no gel-like surface to bite the ball) but the amount of spin it can generate is still plentyful. There is so much more power and above all, it is extremely easy on the arm: now I can play 8 hours on weekends without any aches in my forearm at all. That was a total surprise to me. Tension Stability Spin Comfort Feel Control Power Durability Compared to: n/a Satisfied? This string plays unbelievable on Wilson nSix-One 95 18x20 stringbed. Be sure to string it AT LEAST 5% below your usual poly tension, preferrably

What a waste of money. I can see why this string is so cheap. It's like playing with a wet sponge. Had it taken out and replaced in the first week. Don't bother. Satisfied?
